one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 1 Peter 1:1-12.
Peter greeted believers and praised God.

questions.questionText: 3. What does Peter want his audience to know about salvation?
4. What do you learn about the hope believers have in Christ?
5. How does this impact your perspective on suffering?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 1 Peter 1:13-2:3.
Peter reminds believers to be holy.

questions.questionText: 6. a. Define "holiness." (Use a dictionary, if necessary.)
6. b. How does Peter describe holiness in a believer's life?

7. Why would Peter have written about Jesus as a "lamb without blemish or defect" (verse 17)? (Use any Scripture reference for your answer. For help, see Exodus 12:5; Leviticus 1:2-3; Isaiah 53:7; John 1:29; Revelation 5:6.)
8. Describe how a person is born again. Which aspect of your new life in Christ would you like to see God strengthen?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 1 Peter 2:4-10.
Peter calls believers living stones and Jesus the Cornerstone.

questions.questionText: 9. Verses 4-8 describe Jesus as a Stone. Write a description of each reference to a stone in the passage.
10. a. How is Jesus a cornerstone to some people and a stumbling stone to others?
10. b. How do people attempt to remain neutral about Jesus? Why is that impossible?
11. In verses 9-10, list the privileges of believers. Write which ones mean the most to you.

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 1 Peter 2:11-25.
Peter challenges believers to glorify God in their behavior.

questions.questionText: 12. In what ways can a Christian live as an alien and stranger in today's world? How are you living in this way?
13. What does submission to unjust suffering look like today?
14. How do Peter's admonitions compare with how other people act toward civil authorities today?
15. In what ways has Christ set the example for you when you suffer unjustly? How has this changed or expanded your view of submission?
16. How did this week's study impact your thinking about how you can engage with the world, especially unbelievers?
17. Passage Discovery (homiletics, word study, etc.) for group and administrative leaders: 1 Peter 1-2
